website_summaries.verdict: A thick cream in a convenient flip-top jar. If your child has sensitive skin, however, you may want to look elsewhere.
pros: Thick consistency w/zinc oxide and a light scent
cons: A few reports of dried-out product upon purchase
May not be effective for all rashes/skin types

customer_reviews.title: Different product?
customer_reviews.text: What is going on here? This is not like the product I have been using on my kids for the last 5 years. It looks like Vaseline. Pictured on the right in the last jar we bought, and on the left is this current purchase. It's not expired.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Buchanan

customer_reviews.title: Best diaper rash product ever
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this product. My daughter has very sensitive new born skin and no matter how quick and often we changed her, she developed a diaper rash on her bottom with skin breakdown. Very red and raw. Tried the hospital's aquaphore and another product specific for diaper rash without great results. Bought this and within a few days her bottom healed and has kept her skin rash free for the 2 months since we started using this on her. I highly highly recommend this as a protectant or to heal a baby's bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: I previously ordered this from Amazon and it was fine but am afraid to do so after this experience
customer_reviews.text: Ointment is seperated. I called the Boudreaux's company. They said this happens when it is exposed to high temperatures. They said do not use it. You will not be able to remix it. Unfortunately I did not open the product until 1 month after receiving and it is too late to request refund. Be advised. I previously ordered this from Amazon and it was fine but am afraid to do so after this experience.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Brown

customer_reviews.title: Most recently I had a bacterial rash that I could not get rid of and I used it and it took it away like nothing prescribed could
customer_reviews.text: I learned about this product many years ago on the Oprah show. I believe it was created for babies with diaper rash but I have used it for a lot of things. Most recently I had a bacterial rash that I could not get rid of and I used it and it took it away like nothing prescribed could.
customer_reviews.author: mlady

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work one bit
customer_reviews.text: Unimpressive, my 13 month old has never had a diaper rash in her life. Always put on a & d before bed as a precaution, but I hate the smell! So, switched to the butt paste (it smelled better at least) and after the 2nd night she woke up with a diaper rash! Continued use until a new tub of A & D came in and it did nothing for the rash. Her rash cleared up with just 2 applications of the A & D. I'm sad it didn't work. I wanted it to work so bad, I truly despise the smell of A&D, sadly I will have to continue using it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Pickett

customer_reviews.title: Prevents rashes
customer_reviews.text: I use this every night on my diaper-wearing kids. My kids haven’t had any problems with diaper rash since we use Boudreaux’s as a preventative measure. The tub lasts a long time, too! I think we only went through 3-4 tubs when my son was in diapers, and I continued to use the butt paste on him when he wore diapers/pull ups at night during potty training (so 3.5 years of using it at least 1x day, usually more—especially during the first few months). I now use this on my daughter, and she hasn’t had any problems either. I like Boudreaux’s more than Desitin because it is easier to spread and clean up.
customer_reviews.author: KKul

customer_reviews.title: Be cautious
customer_reviews.text: A couple issues right off. The flip top may be convenient for the parents for the baby but don't leave it out bc your child may easily gain access. Second only buy one cream at a time and see how your child reacts. Our toddler had a horrible reaction to the cream that caused a red rash all over. The cream is very thick and Im sure it works well but like all things, when trying been products use small amounts in the beginning
customer_reviews.author: Steph and Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Great sized tub to have at home!
customer_reviews.text: Boudreaux's butt paste is our go-to everyday diaper ointment and this tub is a great size to have at home. The flip top lid makes it nice and easy to scoop out the paste (even easier with a diaper bum brush!). It goes on smooth and our baby has never had a bad diaper rash. I did notice that it does have a slight smell compared to other diaper ointments, but it's not too noticeable or bothersome.
customer_reviews.author: Gwen N.

customer_reviews.title: Fake product?
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought this product before and it’s always been a brownish paste...this time it’s clear almost like Vaseline. Inside the container looks like around the edges that maybe there use to be the original brownish paste in there..:I think I’m going to be throwing this product away. I don’t think I trust it.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Contreras

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work on my ten month old
customer_reviews.text: I was gifted the maximum strength at a baby shower and finally went through all of it. I wanted to try a more natural product and therefore bought the 16 oz original. It does nothing to protect my daughter. She has actually developed a rash since I've been using it, which was a month ago. I am reaching out to the company for a refund and may change my rating based on their customer service, but as for now, there is no way I would recommend this product. Her entire "area" is red and I'll have to purchase the maximum strength asap so it doesn't get worse.
customer_reviews.author: Jaclyn Thies

customer_reviews.title: Thick and Lasting!
customer_reviews.text: I love how a little bit goes a long way with this paste. It's actually more like a paste than a lotion, unlike many other popular brands out there. We just use the size of a nickel to cover our son. It lasts through a couple diaper changes and wiping. It spreads nice and smooth for how thick it is too. I highly recommend getting the bum brushes for application! Since it is fairly waterproof, getting it on your hands or under your nails is no fun.
customer_reviews.author: Eyes That Shine

customer_reviews.title: My son's bottom loves this ...
customer_reviews.text: Diaper rash be gone. This stuff works wonders as soon as any kind of redness appears, smear on a dollup, and next diaper change it's gone. This stuff also works wonders on blisters in adults. I walk a lot and often develop blisters on my feet. At the first sign of a blister I'll goop this on my foot, cover it in a sock (make it one you don't care about, because this stuff will ruin it) - and the next day the skin is soft and supple and the blister is gone. I would imagine runners may love it.
customer_reviews.author: Web Geek

customer_reviews.title: Great diaper rash cream
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended to me before I was even pregnant! My friend told me should I ever have kids to definitely use this. So when I had a baby I went straight to it! It is really good stuff! Good consistency and works so well. Whenever there is a rash we pop this on a few times and the rash settles. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kate S

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is a must have! I find this brand works much better than others, like desitin, and this size is such a great value! With kids at daycare, you cant always control when they are changed, so always having a mild cream on them helps. It is hard to get the cream out of the bottom of the tub when it's getting close to empty, so I recommend getting an applicator (or something similar that you already have) to get every last little bit.
customer_reviews.author: Heather A.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work as good as Destin, won’t be buying again
customer_reviews.text: I like the ingredients of this better than other products but I won’t be buying it again. I wanted to try this because it has less questionable ingredients than Destin which had been working great for us. Unfortunately this product doesn’t work as well. My son starts to get a little red with this unfortunately
customer_reviews.author: Abby Ward

customer_reviews.title: Nothing else works
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could find this size at the stores. They used to sell it. Now, all I can find is the small tubes. I have found no other rash cream that works but this. Even their new with aloe and extra strength, in the tubes, does not work like this stuff. This one is always in some type of yellow container that says original. Get past the color or it. Your babies and toddlers will thank you for never having to have rashes or ones that clear the same day quickly.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: Fraud, counterfeit,or quality control issue?
customer_reviews.text: We have been buying the tubes or Butt Paste for some time and it works extremely well, 5. With two kids, we are going through it so fast we decided to buy this large tub of Butt Paste. What we received in the tub looks very different than the tube paste. It is clear/white and more of a jelly than the brownish creamy tube paste. It seems like just Vaseline. The tube paste texture and application is superior to the tub paste. Based on other review, this may be a quality control issue. I hope it is not a conterfeit issue as I would not want to be putting unknown substances on my child.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Quality Control is a serious issue for this product and company
customer_reviews.text: We received 2 tubs of the butt paste and the tubs were filled with a jelly type substance. I noticed around the inside of the tub of butt paste there was a small amount of the clay like substance that the product really looks like, so I scooped out the jelly to find that half way down the jar had the real stuff in the bottom. I have seen several reviews with this same issue... This is not a "bad batch" it is a total scam!!! This company is putting our children at risk!!! SHAME ON YOU!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Newman

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite rash cream. I have tried many others. I even prefer it over the red beudrouxs. even though the red one is extra strength and has more zinc this one is thicker and stays on longer meaning more dry skin and less rash. My baby pooped 10+ times per day, it was nearly impossible to keep his skin clean. This helped him soooo much.
customer_reviews.author: delilah

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT FROM AMAZON
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love Boudreaux’s butt paste but please be warned...we have received 2, 16 oz jars from Amazon that appears to be nothing more than petroleum jelly. Per the manufacturer, this happens when the product is exposed to high heat and should not be used!!! Please don’t waste your money, buy locally instead!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Wilkens

customer_reviews.title: Best Butt Paste Ever!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many different butt pastes on my little one, but this is by far my most favorite! I put this on at the first sign of a rash and it's gone in no time. I like to get the big container because it's a better value for your money. I send it to daycare and it last quite a while.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Czekalski

customer_reviews.title: which was totally useless. This took care of the diaper rash right ...
customer_reviews.text: We used both this and the butt paste that comes in the red container. This one is stickier and thicker and we prefer it. Has a subtle fragrance to it and wipes off with normal baby wipes. It definitely works - in the hospital we were putting vaseline on, which was totally useless. This took care of the diaper rash right away, and now we continue to use it preventatively. You need a dimes worth, maybe a little more, and we smear it on every part of the baby that is covered by the diaper. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: S.M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product! Please make it a different color
customer_reviews.text: I put this on my daughter after every diaper change. The only time she has gotten a diaper rash was the one day that I didn't put this on her! It then worked to clear up that diaper rash within a couple of days. I love that it comes in a big jar so I can easily scoop some out with my diaper cream applicator. The one thing I hate is that it's brown. I check if my daughter has pooped by lifting up and taking a peek inside of her diaper, so in a dim room it's hard to tell if the brown substance in her diaper is this cream or poop.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle C.

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as Aquaphor
customer_reviews.text: My baby has diaper rash, and I started out using buttpaste. THen I went to the doctor, and she said to use Aquaphor. All in all, I have tried 4 products: petroleum jelly, buttpaste, desitin, and aquaphor. Aquaphor works the best, though not 100%. Buttpaste and Desitin seem to be about the same. Regular petroleum jelly was okay but didn't have any healing properties. Maybe buy a smaller package at first until you see what works with your baby.
customer_reviews.author: mercuryvalTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Only thing we use to treat and prevent diaper rash. Love this product. I'm sure there are less expensive creams out there but I Why mess with success. My only complaint is its hard to get the last bit out unless u have one of those diaper cream spreader sticks.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Feather

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this product. We bought a 16oz container when my daughter was born and it lasted till she was nearly one. I scoop a little into a travel container for her diaper bag and keep the big container at home. The ingredients are gentle and the fragrance is very light and pleasant. After our first container finished we took some time to reorder, and in that time our daughter developed a bad rash. We tried the other recommended products, nothing got it to fully resolve except this but paste. I definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Thayanne

customer_reviews.title: The Best!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! This huge tub will last almost a year. I highly recommend it. It's nice not to have to squeeze a tube while wrangling a wiggling baby. I also reccomend a diper cream applicator to make everything easier and cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: Tiger Laura

customer_reviews.title: HUGE MUST HAVE!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good buy for the Price. This is a must have for all parents and would be a great addition to any gift you are giving to a new parent. This bottle will last a long time. I Paired this with the "Dr. Talbots Silicone Diaper Cream Brush with Suction Base, Aqua" this makes it easy to apply without the mess. DEFINITELY TRY THESE TWO TOGETHER
customer_reviews.author: stefani

customer_reviews.title: Diaper rash no more!!!
customer_reviews.text: All parents must have this! I used this product when I had my first born amd second born children (14 and 12 years ago). Now that I have my newborn I am using it again. It is effective to heal diaper rash and preventing it from reoccurring. I love this product!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mommyof2

customer_reviews.title: Really fast results!
customer_reviews.text: My 5 month old has had a pretty bad diaper rash this week. Wedela Candula cream wasn't doing much to help it, it was just getting worse. I ordered this butt paste and used it twice on his bum before bedtime. When we woke up in the morning, his rash was significantly improved!!!! I love this stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: The paste looks different from the one I buy at the store.
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying this for 2 years at the grocery store and this is the first time I bought it online. But this time the paste has some weird looking area where it looks like the product hasn't been mixed well. Idk if I trust it. Might end up returning it.
customer_reviews.author: michael k.

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Does not leak. One tub will last you a lifetime! My 1 month old son loves it and so do I. I use use it because I work in a very hot factory,and also use it for my son. It takes care of rashes VERY fast! And smells a little like coffee!
customer_reviews.author: Drew Sinke

customer_reviews.title: Best for Tushy's
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with this diaper cream. We also use the Boudreaux's Max strength cream, but find this preferable for daily use. It almost has a vaseline consistency/ a little goes a long way. I found Destin and A&D too runny compared with the Boudreaux's brand. And I love that they make it in a tub form- since you will be using this stuff for years!
customer_reviews.author: MinimalistMomTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: It works and is convenient
customer_reviews.text: I’m using this butt paste with my third baby as I did with the other two. We love this bigger size, it has a pop top lid, which is nice not having to worry about a screw top. It also works, which is the best part!
customer_reviews.author: Katherine W.

customer_reviews.title: I have been a butt paste user for almost a ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been a butt paste user for almost a year now, but the last tub i bought was unusable. There was a layer of what appeared to be petroleum jelly on top of the paste. A quick Google search informed me that there was a quality control issue with the products delivered through Amazon. To top it off, I realized this after the return window had close. I will not be purchasing this product through Amazon again.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Dimberg

customer_reviews.title: Only butt paste I use!
customer_reviews.text: I've now used this for both my kiddos. I love this stuff. I tried everything with my oldest and this was the only thing that ever helped his diaper rash. Now I use it on my second boys tush and it helps significantly! Glad to have this big ole tub, too! Good to know I won't run out any time soon.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Actually works
customer_reviews.text: I have used this brand for years and never disappoints. Big tub has a pop-lid for ease of use. Would definitely recommend. I went through several different brands before this one. It actually worked. I've tried other variation of This brand and they all work. The red label work great on sevear rash like my first child uses to get.
customer_reviews.author: Imelda Flores

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: I have two young children and this is by far the best diaper rash treatment I’ve used. It literally works in hours most of the time and doesn’t bother either of my sons skin at all. I don’t mind the smell of it but my boyfriend HATES it lol so that’s one thing to keep in mind that it does have a scent to it
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: I swear by this stuff
customer_reviews.text: The nurses in the hospital gave my son a horrible diaper rash that was actually bleeding. They were using their own sticky cream and then leaving poop behind because it wouldn’t come off. I held my cool and brought in my own buttpaste and it was gone in no time. I would never put anything else on my baby
customer_reviews.author: Jesspkt

customer_reviews.title: The only diaper cream you should buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is the only baby diaper cream that works. Every time I buy a different brand I regret it. Hoping this giant one will last me until potty training. The flip top is a good design but still can be a little messy to get out.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Millikan

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this butt paste since our baby was born, 10 months ago. We put a little on after every diaper change and he has never had diaper rash. No redness or anything. This paste is amazing! It smells good and it’s so great for his skin. We won’t use anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Tasha

customer_reviews.title: Very good stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Really love this stuff it works like magic and my baby appreciates a rash free butt!! Glad it comes in a big container the tubes from target were so small and didn’t last long.
customer_reviews.author: Aida Desmarais

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I prefer tube to this jar. Tubes are easier to use. There is more chance of contamination while using this. Product is good but tubes are better than jar
customer_reviews.author: SHABU

customer_reviews.title: Best Butt Paste Ever
customer_reviews.text: What is this made of, virgin unicorn tears? I don’t know and I don’t care, because it makes all rashes so much better. Thankfully we don’t get too much diaper rash - bc as an infant, my child would scream bloody murder if there was even a tiny dot of blue on that ever so helpful diaper line - but when there is something, this stuff makes it all go away. Like magic in a jar.
customer_reviews.author: Renata Breytman

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Ok, ignore the price. While I know it seems pricey, it's not. In the long run, this lasts me about 3 months. It's smooth and adheres to the skin well.
customer_reviews.author: Caro V

customer_reviews.title: Rash, too soft
customer_reviews.text: Not a fan of this stuff. Gave my baby a rash - which isn't a big deal because sometimes people have sensitive skin. I really didn't like how soft/ "melty" it is. It begins to melt at body temp, and gets soft and smudgy when you apply it, so the barrier isn't that great compared to desitin.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Winter Rose

customer_reviews.title: Prevents diaper rash and redness
customer_reviews.text: I use both original & extra strength for my baby girl. We tried desitin and other creams this is perfect it prevents from diaper rash & reduces redness too. A must have for parents.
customer_reviews.author: Sameer Rajani

customer_reviews.title: Great for swift, one-handed diaper changes
customer_reviews.text: It spreads easily, does have the advertised good smell, and a little bit goes a long ways. The tub is so much better than the tube especially for those frantic times when you only have one hand available and you need to act fast. The lid easily flips open and even when it is running low you can easily and quickly scrape along the bottom while still holding squirming feet with your other hand. The only reason I do not give it a full five stars is because it is a bit difficult to get off of clothes.
customer_reviews.author: BZ Herz

customer_reviews.title: Made it worse
customer_reviews.text: This product may work for some people, but it made my sons diaper rash worse. Since I can’t return it I’m stuck with diaper rash cream I have no use for.
customer_reviews.author: Shelbell

customer_reviews.title: Day to Day Use
customer_reviews.text: We use this on our son everyday to prevent diaper rash. It works like a charm. I bought the spatula for an easier (less messy) application.
customer_reviews.author: Green

customer_reviews.title: Clears rashes right up!
customer_reviews.text: I have to say that Boudreaux's Butt Paste is one of my favorite diaper creams! I only got one tube at my baby shower and the rest was Desitin and I finally used all of it up. Before switching to the butt paste my daughter had weird rash with white bumps but as soon as I put this product on her it was gone the next diaper change. I don't have to worry about my daughter being red whenever I change her diaper now. I like the consistency, unlike Desitin it comes out thick and spreads on super smooth. I also love the smell, but that might just be my preference.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Tippett

customer_reviews.title: Product is fake? Just Vaseline not butt paste. Beware of quality
customer_reviews.text: We buy this butt paste from amazon every couple months. We just opened this one and it is clear like Vaseline. This is alarming to us since that isn’t the normal look or texture of the product. Apparently we are past our rerun date for the product. I would be wary to buy this expensive diaper rash cream from amazon in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Essential for baby
customer_reviews.text: I like this variant more than the tube one because of its convenience. When changing my daughter's diapers, I use one hand to hold her legs and the other to do everything else. It's easier to just dip into the tub of butt paste instead of having to squeeze it out of the tube. It's a good buy because we know we'll use it on her in at least the next two years. It's also significantly reduced the redness on her bottom, even on her belly (just under the belly button) where the diaper rubs on and irritates her skin.
customer_reviews.author: Riya Seifert

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: I have seen some reviews and pictures where it wasn't the actual product and it came messed up but I honestly don't have any complaints the exact product came to me I think maybe some people just got unlucky.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan H.

customer_reviews.title: Best diaper cream ever! A must have!!
customer_reviews.text: This literally saved my baby's bottom!!! The Pampers disposable swim diapers gave my daughter a horrible rash. Doctors couldn't figure out what the rash was from or how to treat it. Then after awhile without swimming and trying this I figured it out. I love this product and will always have it, as long as she's in diapers that is!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Freda

customer_reviews.title: Love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: Love this stuff. My husband uses it for saddle sores from riding his. Bike. I was getting chaffing from my bra and under my arms during exercise. I tried lots of thing that didn't help. So finally I grabbed my husbands but paste and tried it. Not only did it release the chaffing but it worked as a deorderant.
customer_reviews.author: Boester

customer_reviews.title: Game changer
customer_reviews.text: It’s a little messy without the applicator but it really helps to prevent diaper rashes and heal existing rashes. I usually use it at night on my little one because she sleeps for 8-9 hours it’s a great barrier to a wet diaper that would usually cause irritation without it.
customer_reviews.author: Dominica

customer_reviews.title: Don’t like color
customer_reviews.text: Don’t like that this product is a light brown color. Works well but as an adult who uses similar products don’t like the color transfer to undergarments even though it washes out.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy S. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Love the brand but this original stuff doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Love the brand but this original stuff doesn't work. Buy this brand in the red tub, extra strength. Works instantly and spreads much easier than this stuff. Can also be applied if child has bad rash before bath time and even under the neck for rashes.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Vaseline?
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I've purchased this product off of Amazon. The first time the product came beige creamy consistency as it normally should be. I opened up the Second tub and it looks like just plain Vaseline.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best product for diaper rash!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best product to use on a baby’s butt to protect against diaper rash. Odorless and protects very well! It is skin colored which is a plus!
customer_reviews.author: Manuel Ramos

customer_reviews.title: Chemical Burns
customer_reviews.text: I normally buy Balmex, but lately the Balmex tubs from Amazon have been gritty like sand with fibers in it, so I thought I would try Boudreaux’s as it had good reviews. Big mistake for my little one, as this rash cream caused a moderate chemical burn on her sensitive skin 😠 Not sure if it’s from Amazon (seems like they carry inferior/damaged products), but I will never buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Sabra Adams

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Within 1 week of switching to this product, my baby developed diaper rash—something he NEVER had when we used Desitin. I’m tossing this stuff and going back to what actually works.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Only works for a little while
customer_reviews.text: I bought a small tube to try on my son and liked it. Unfortunately, this bigger tube started to smell bad after a little over a month. Also, when I first bought and use it, it was only for prevention but since my son developed a mild rash, it didn't completely take it away. I had to go back to using tripple paste and desitin.
customer_reviews.author: Ceecee T

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: We wanted to really like this but it didn’t help get rid of my baby’s bad diaper rash. We switched to triple A ointment and it cleared it up.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

customer_reviews.title: RN recommended as the BEST for baby's butt!
customer_reviews.text: Even RN's need to ask advice every now and then... on FB I asked my "friends" to please recommend that "ONE" product that they just couldn't live without when it came to their babies. A dear friend of mine has a child, who is now 12, that is completely dependent and needs her Mom's 24 hour care. This friend said Boudreaux is the only diaper cream she would recommend. How could I argue her experience - 12 years using all diaper creams and Boudreaux is her only pick. I have used it now for 9 months and agree it's the only one I will use too.
customer_reviews.author: Smart RN

customer_reviews.title: No complaints, will buy again...
customer_reviews.text: I already prefer butt paste compared to the other diaper rash creams (goes on thick and cleans off easily....plus it improved my newborn son's poor red butt) but its awfully nice in the tub. As always, Amazon did awesome getting it to me quick and nicely packaged. **UPDATE** I bought this product July 2012, and I still have half a tub left. I use this product daily although not as often as I used to. Its now Jan. 2013 and I'm pleased with how long this stuff lasted. I will buy another tub when mine runs out because it definitely saved me bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda C.

customer_reviews.title: Great product to protect your baby's bottom
customer_reviews.text: Nothing better for a case of the red a$$. Seriously, this stuff makes my son's booty look baby smooth. If I notice red irritated skin during a diaper change, I slather on some Boudreaux's. Next diaper change, his bottom is all better.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael M.

customer_reviews.title: Best yet.
customer_reviews.text: Impressed with how well this works. Cleared up the diaper rash remarkably well. Worked better than desitine.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: ingredients separated in tub
customer_reviews.text: Ingredients were separated into two parts inside the tub - vaseline-like texture on the top and creme-like texture on the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Madeline

customer_reviews.title: A must have!
customer_reviews.text: Use this every night on my baby’s bottom since she’s in 12-hour disposables and sleeps 8 hours in the night. I would def recommend buying a silicone applicator as it’s hard to come off your fingers and nails.
customer_reviews.author: Moll Doll

customer_reviews.title: Favorite baby gift
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this for years on my kids and now I always include it in my baby gift baskets. Best cream for preventing and treating diaper rash or chafing.
customer_reviews.author: Meaghan Hoggan

customer_reviews.title: Great product !
customer_reviews.text: One of my stand by brands for my son. This stuff is great and stays put! Creates a great barrier and us worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Works very well!
customer_reviews.text: Really effective paste. Hard to reach with your finger as container reaches below the halfway point.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect all around cream
customer_reviews.text: I use a dab of this with every diaper and my baby has never had a rash. I put some on her when she had a rash shortly after she was born and it went away the next day. I will forever use this stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Rash is gone
customer_reviews.text: Our first time using anything but Desitin - actually pretty good! The rash is gone!
customer_reviews.author: AwesomedocR

customer_reviews.title: Crazy name but good stuff.
customer_reviews.text: I went through several products (both creams and powders) before someone recommended this to me. I use this for under my breasts ... Crazy name but good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Only Product That Works
customer_reviews.text: My son rarely gets a diaper rash, but when he does, Butt Paste is the only thing that works to get rid of it fast! Pros: - fast relief - thick ointment that doesn't rub off of the area you are applying it to - ODOR FREE! - tub makes it extremely easy to open, apply, and close with one hand Cons: - I have noticed that if I get the ointment on something white, it leaves a stain. This isn't a huge con for me, as this has only happened a handful of times.
customer_reviews.author: JBG

customer_reviews.title: Reccomended by Nurse
customer_reviews.text: Nurse recommended this, it is by far the best! We use a cheaper brand to prevent diaper rash, and apply this if a diaper rash appears.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Oldham

customer_reviews.title: No diaper rash with this!
customer_reviews.text: This cream works fantastically well at preventing diaper rash. We slather a ton on at every diaper change and when applying it like that, we have never had even a whiff of a rash. For a few days my MIL was doing diaper changes and was only using a meager amount and he started to get a little rash. I told her to use more and the rash went away again lickety split and hasn’t been back! So use a decent amount and it works wonders. Smells nice too!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Wong

customer_reviews.title: Five stars
customer_reviews.text: Works way better than desiten and clears up redness very quickly! This tub is a great price for the amount you get! Gifted it for two different baby showers and also use it on my own daughter.
customer_reviews.author: Sasseyw

customer_reviews.title: Works well and smells pleasant
customer_reviews.text: This cream seems to work very well on diaper rash and smells really good. It also wipes away easily and I don't feel like I need to scrub to get any excess off of my daughter. The only reason I am rating it 4 stars is for the lid on the jar. Within a day of opening it (opening the lid maybe 3 times?), the hinge on the flip top lid cracked and broke half way through. Now, we are just extra careful when opening and closing the jar so that rest of the hinge doesn't break. A little disappointed in the jar construction, but otherwise it's a great product!
customer_reviews.author: BrandiS

customer_reviews.title: It’s really works
customer_reviews.text: It’s good cream with convenient container. I like how it’s smell, just don’t need to buy too big package.
customer_reviews.author: Yony

customer_reviews.title: Works great on babies
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a new mother who loves this product. Was thrilled about the cap on it.
customer_reviews.author: GAD781

customer_reviews.title: For my first kid I was like “oh I’m not going to use petroleum products” and ...
customer_reviews.text: For my first kid I was like “oh I’m not going to use petroleum products” and after I couldn’t cure a diaper rash with Honest or Babyganics I gave in; two years and one more diapered kid later, I buy the big tub of it on subscribe & save. BRING ON THE BOUDREAUX’S!
customer_reviews.author: Clinton D Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Best diaper cream
customer_reviews.text: This tub of diaper cream comes in as a life saver sometimes. My baby gets irritated and this cream helps sooo much! A must have for moms.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Best cream out there
customer_reviews.text: This diaper rash cream has been good at clearing up all rashes my daughter has had. I like desitin as well but the packaging on butt paste is better. The lid flips open along it easy to swipe out the cream while holding your child steady on the changing table. The consistency of the cream is thin and creamy which is KOVE because a little goes a long way. This tub lasts me several months and I use it after each diaper change. The smell is subtle but nice and the cor is a light brown.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: We swear by this. Great rash cream!
customer_reviews.text: Baby had a bad rash and we bought the stronger rash cream and it worked great. We bought this for regular use and it works really well. We use a little and it really helps. This tub will last you a LONG time
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: zaps the rash in one application-every time
customer_reviews.text: This is the only thing that zaps my sons diaper rash. Put it on one time and poof the rash is gone. I have the bum applicator stick, so I can just pop the lid on the cream and stick the applicator in. Makes it so much easier with my squirmy child. Love this stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Kim D

customer_reviews.title: This stuff works! I put it on my babe ...
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works! I put it on my babe as soon as I see the slightest irritation and poof! It's gone. I generally use it at night as an overnight barrier. Only downside, I'm not a fan of the smell.
customer_reviews.author: Moon Valley Crab

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your time with this brand
customer_reviews.text: I feel like the formula of the product has gotten thinner and cheaper. I first thought i got a bad batch, bought another bottle, and it was just as watered down. My daughter got a bad diaper rash and had to buy another brand bc this paste was no longer cutting it.
customer_reviews.author: ARligon

customer_reviews.title: Good For Anything!!
customer_reviews.text: Wonder Drug From the South!! We used this item when our son was a newborn & 14 yrs later we all still use it & makes a GREAT baby shower gift. GREAT for chaffing between legs, under arm pits, mosquito or bug bites, burns, anything you can think of. Me, my husband & 14 yr old son use it almost daily.
customer_reviews.author: Melody Morgan

customer_reviews.title: great value, great results
customer_reviews.text: We've got three little ones so have had our fair share of diaper rash. This stuff has worked very well. It's much thicker than desitin and smells kind of nice. One tub lasted us over a year with three in diapers. So it's a good value. Just ordered our second tub that I expect will last us until we no longer use diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Teej

customer_reviews.text: Its a nice product. :) It will be nice if they change the color from brown to white, sometimes I got confused because of the color
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best!
customer_reviews.text: Using for years, yes it works on prickly heat to staph infection healing. It's not easy to clean off, and that is why it works so well. It is the best barrier cream around. Warm soapy water and gauze or a washcloth will get this off, but patience please. Eases friction, irritation, swelling. Can't live without it!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia C. Huerta -NA

customer_reviews.title: Best diaper rash cream ever!
customer_reviews.text: Best diaper rash cream ever!! Best price anywhere! With three children of my own and running a child care for 21 years this is by far the best cream for diaper rash. It heels and protects.
customer_reviews.author: T Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Tub design is so helpful
customer_reviews.text: I love being able to just flip up the lid on this tub. So much easier than unscrewing a lid or dealing with messy tubes. The paste is also very nice, though I knocked off one star because we resort to a different maximum strength cream when our baby gets red down below.
customer_reviews.author: tracey cowan

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: Better than any other diaper rash cream. Works pretty fast
customer_reviews.author: Karla G

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: We swear by this for our 15month old. It helps her stay rash free and really helps when she does get some redness
customer_reviews.author: Erica Mangers

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS THE BEST THING FOR YOUR BABYS BOOTY
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS THE BEST THING FOR YOUR BABYS BOOTY! Goes on smoothly and doesn’t cake on like other creams, has a nice smell nothing over powering, and it’s lasts forever! My son is 2 months and I’m only a quarter into it! So worth it I’m getting the travel size
customer_reviews.author: daniel cardenas

product_meta.title: Boudreaux's Butt Paste Diaper Rash Ointment, Original, 16 Oz
product_meta.description: Size:1 Pound (Pack of 1)Developed by a pharmacist and father of four, Boudreaux's Butt Paste Brand has been trusted for over 40 years by pediatricians and parents to help protect irritated skin due to diaper rash and to instantly seal out wetness. When used on a daily basis, it is also a great way to help prevent diaper rash. Original Boudreaux's Butt Paste Diaper Rash Ointment is a thick, protective diaper rash paste with 16% Zinc Oxide and is ideal for treating mild to moderate diaper rash. It starts to soothe on contact, seals out moisture and helps keep baby’s boo-tay dry. Original Boudreaux's Butt Paste is free from dyes, preservatives, parabens and talc. Boudreaux's Butt Paste products are FSA- and HSA-eligible in the U.S.
feature_bullets: Helps treat and prevent diaper rash as a skin protectant (16% zinc oxide)
Protects irritated skin due to diaper rash and helps seal out wetness
Discomfort relief starts fast from the first use and provides long-lasting protection
Pediatrician recommended brand; Free from dyes, preservatives, parabens and talc
